body.name: Fossil Gen 6 Wellness Edition 44mm Touchscreen Smart Watch with Alexa Built-In, Fitness Tracker, Activity Tracker, Sleep Tracker, GPS, Speaker, Music Control, Smartphone Notifications
features: COMPATIBILITY - Smartwatches with Wear OS by Google are compatible with phones running the latest version of Android or iOS. Qualcomm 4100+ chipset has 30% enhanced performance. Improved power, more reliable connection and up to 4x range with Bluetooth 5.

ALEXA ENABLED - Get a little extra help with Alexa built-in. Easily access the Amazon Alexa app to get quick news and information, check the weather, set timers and alarms, control smart home devices, and more - all through the sound of your voice.

HEALTH - Automatically tracks activity goals, steps, sleep, cardio, and more. Activity modes with GPS keep you on track with your distance and path. Advanced sensors provide data to power your health and fitness tracker apps. Swimproof.

PERSONALIZED STYLE - Always-on display now brighter with more colors and higher pixel count. Thousands of watch faces to personalize your look and always see the time. Hundreds of apps from fitness, music, social, news, stop watches and more.

STAY CONNECTED - Notifications for calls, texts, apps. Automatic time zone and calendar syncing. Answer and make calls directly on your watch when your phone is out of reach. This smart watch features a speaker, microphone, and customizable buttons.

BATTERY LIFE - Our new caseback and included magnetic charger cable allow for faster charging than other generations. Charge up to 80% in 30 minutes. Optimize your battery life with simplified Smart Battery Modes.
body.description: Tap into wellness. This 44mm Gen 6 Wellness Edition touchscreen smartwatch is designed for every body. Featuring a silicone strap that can be worn for everything from swimming to sleeping, this smartwatch is powered with Wear OS 3 for better health and wellness metrics. Wear OS by Google works with phones running the latest version of Android™ (excluding Go edition and phones without Google Play Store) or iOS. Supported features may vary between platforms and countries with compatibility subject to change. Battery life is based on usage and after updates install. To avoid damage to your watch, only use with included charger. Do not use a USB hub, USB splitter, USB y-cable, battery pack or other peripheral device to charge. Product should be kept more than 20cm away from implanted medical devices to minimize potential for RF interference. Soaps, cleaning products, and abrasive materials can cause damage to your smartwatch.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Gen 6 Wellness Smart Watch Tap into wellness with the Gen 6 Wellness Edition smartwatch. Designed for every body, it’s powered by Wear OS 3 for improved health and wellness metrics like heart rate zones, sleep insights, SpO2 and VO2 Max. Each of our Gen 6 Wellness smartwatches comes with a quality 20mm silicone strap that can be worn for everything from swimming to sleeping without sacrificing any comfort. Our classic always-on display is now brighter with more colors and thousands of watch faces to personalize your look.

Iconic Smartwatches Fossil's smartwatch collection combines the latest trends with our iconic styles to create the wearable tech you need to stay connected. Our unique pieces are compatible with Android and iPhone software so that you're always in style, and in the know. Straps for Every Style Keep your look fresh by mixing and matching your Fossil watch straps, available in a variety of sizes and materials, including classic leather, striking stainless steel and versatile silicone. We have a range of colors for any look, from casual to dressy to everything in between.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Daily charging is not a problem for me
reviews.reviewText: I was considering the Pixel Watch 2 as my first smartwatch, but the end of year deals on this Fossil Gen6 Wellness made trying out WearOS much more reasonable from a price perspective. One of my associates has the Pixel Watch 2 and one has the Skagen Falster Gen6 (same hardware as my Fossil Gen6 Wellness), so I have been able to make some comparisons.I love this watch. It looks great, has very cool looking watch faces (without having to install 3rd party ones), and gets me through a full day of use and charges quickly at the end of the day. I put it on the charger while I'm winding down for the evening and it gets back up to 100% quickly. I don't wear it to sleep but I don't leave it on the charger while I am sleeping because I don't like to leave fully charged devices plugged in to their chargers for hours. In the morning I let it charge back to 100% while I am showering, and then I am good to go for the day. This is also exactly how I charge my Pixel 6a phone, so it works out well.Although I don't use the watch for sleep tracking I do use the step counter every day, and I occasionally look at my heart rate (usually after running to catch the subway) and blood oxygen level (just for fun). It closely matches the readings I get with my pulse oximeter, so I must be more compatible with this watch's sensors than the people who don't have the same good experience as I do. Other frequently used features are Google Pay (it's great not having to take out my wallet or phone to use my credit card), the Weather app, and yes, I prefer Alexa over Google Assistant and I ask Alexa questions throughout the day. I like pressing to activate Alexa instead of using her wake word, so I don't trigger anyone else's Echo or other Alexa-enabled devices. Google Assistant is also installed on this watch if I decide to switch at any time. I very much like seeing my day's schedule in the Agenda app that pulls from my Google Calendar, and seeing all of the alerts that I would usually have to pull my phone out to read is really useful, and I have to pull my phone out of my pocket much less frequently thanks to this feature. When I do see an alert that I have a text or email that needs a response I do use my phone to reply because the tiny keyboard on the watch strains my old eyes too much.Setup was as time consuming as it would be with a new phone. It came out of the box with WearOS 3, and after pairing it with the Fossil app on my phone it upgraded twice. Once to WearOS 3.5, and then once more for a December update that I understand fixed some problems with WearOS 3.5. I consider myself very fortunate to have purchased this watch after the above updates were made available, as it let me avoid all of the bugs that preceded them. My associate's Pixel Watch 2 also needed time-consuming updates (for WearOS 4), and the only difference in setup between this Gen6 Wellness and the Skagen Gen6 is that the Skagen came out of the box with WearOS 2.x and required a much lengthier update path to WearOS 3.0, then WearOS 3.5, and then the December update. And that Skagen Falster Gen6 is even more stylish than my Fossil so I think it was worth the extra setup effort for the person wearing that one,Comparing to the Pixel Watch 2, I don't see any apparent benefit of its WearOS 4 over my Fossil's WearOS 3.5 yet. The battery life is supposed to be better on the Pixel Watch 2, but in practice it is very close to my Fossil's. That may be because the Pixel Watch 2 user has WhatsApp on their watch and that might be sucking battery.I am very happy that I chose the Fossil Gen 6 over the Pixel Watch 2. There are rumors that Fossil is exiting the WearOS smartwatch business. If that is true then I will get good use from this Fossil watch for a couple of years and then upgrade to a Pixel Watch 3 or 4, or whatever the latest Google offering is at that time. If Fossil stays in the game and makes some next gen WearOS devices, then I will stick with Fossil when it comes time to upgrade.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does what I need
reviews.reviewText: I don't use the wellness features so I can't speak on that. I enjoy it for the most part, the battery just dies so fast. If you wanted to track your sleep you'd have to make sure to charge it before you went to bed

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Returned it after 25 days.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my wife after her Fitbit turned out to be a complete disappointment. She ended up getting it a few days early because I am horrible with surprises and her Fitbit finally stopped working. Initially, she loved it. Once she discovered the app and all of the different watch faces available, she was super excited. It fit comfortably with the factory band and she liked the size of it.I received a lot of texts the first day with it about how much she liked it. She was a little concerned that she couldn't make it through a whole day on a complete charge though. She would put it on the charger before bed, put it on as she walked out the door to work and by the time she got home from work, 9-10 hours later, it was dead. Wouldn't even last 12 hours. That was concerning.Now, after almost 3 weeks, it will only last 5 or 6 hours and is dead. My wife is not a very tech savvy person, I turned off a lot of the features that she wouldn't use or didn't need. Still cannot make it through an 8 hour work day. And within the last 2 days, it has started to freeze up and stop working. It got sent back today. Not even a month old and it has these kinds of issues. She loved the features and the watch, but if it won't last all day what is the point of wearing it?Not sure how the sleep tracking works since it had to stay on the charger at night and could not be worn.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Wife Loves it!!
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I both work in tech and we don't always treat ourselves to the latest/greatest, but we've tried all the smartwatches and always seem to have the best experience with Fossil. My Gen5 has been running strong for 2 years now and it's my everyday wear.The gen6 has been problem free since my wife got it before Christmas. Setup was easy and we got it mates up to her Android phone without issue. Battery life is great and it charges so quickly she can wear it all day and night and charge while she's in the shower.Definitely a solid choice with functionality, comfort, and style.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not for everyone
reviews.reviewText: Looks great, but it's kind of a PoS.1) The watch arrived approx 70% charged in the box. By the time I had finished setting it up, the battery life was under 20%2) It has a proprietary charging system, so good luck replacing that if you damage or lose it.3) It gets warm.4) WearOS is not super intuitive. It takes some discovery to find all the settings to get everything working.5) Lot's of comments online (Fossil, Google, reddit) about not being able to get the weather app to connect. It took me about a day of fiddling with everything to get it to connect.All I want is a large format 50mm+ watch with a battery that will last a couple days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The only thing I dislike is the ability to change faces is too complicated.
Hasta ahora va vien el reloj
Battery life is terrible! Otherwise a fun watch! If only Fossil could fix battery issues
Dura muy poco la pila a comparación de otros smart con las mismas características
La batería no dura ni 24 horas, se desconecta constantemente, se supone que el procesador SD 4100+ era mejor pero la verdad no me parece que tenga potencia mejor que relojes previos, no es para mí.

reviews.reviewerName: Es un reloj muy bonito y elegante pero con iOS están muy limitadas las aplicaciones a diferencia de con Android
